result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Baehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. Drug Buy Reimbursement of $510 is joint and several with co-defendants.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Ruben Rivera, Bridgette Messa and or Rosa  Rivera.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: From Family in support of defendant.

3:29 pm case called. Defendant Michael J. Baehman in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stamman states PSI received-corrections stated on record. DA Blader received PSI-no additions or corrections. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Stamman. No statement by defendant. Court makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: Count 1 ONLY- 5 months WCJ, with Huber, no Good Time Credit. No Credit for time served. To begin no later than January 9, 2016. No objections to jail transfer. CONDITIONS ON BOTH COUNTS:  AODA and follow through,  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with Ruben Rivera, Bridgette Messa, and/or Rosa RiveraTerms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. $510 Drug Buy Reimbursement Money, joint and several with co-defendants. DNA sample and surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 3:33 PM: Defendant Michael J. Baehman in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Pleas to be entered to Ct Nos 1 and 2 today with a request for PSI.  State will cap and argue for probationary sentence with argued terms.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Court confirms quantity level as to both counts and maximum penalty difference in each count.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct Nos 1 and 2:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct No 3 DRI.  Upon recommendation of counsel, PSI ordered.  Def reminded that bond conditions will continue pending sentencing and consequences for violating terms of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Phillip Stamman in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stamman requesting a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Case called @ 2:13 p.m. Defendant Michael J. Baehman in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  NG plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:05 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Phillip Stamman in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stamman requesting a preliminary hearing waiver date and arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Phillip Stamman in court, appearing via telephone.   Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Stamman - denial for TAD Court, requests add'l STC to consider State's offer.  Further STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:05 am.
from DA's Office with attached Buy Money Reimbursment Request - $510

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing or ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Michael J. Baehman in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  States recommends $2000 Signature Bond.  No objection by defense.   Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 20 day time limit for pre-lim hearing.  Counsel will be looking into possible TAD referral as suggested by Court.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
